NOP552.name: Medical Neuroscience
NOP552.description: Correlation of normal structure and function of the human nervous system with clinical testing, classical lesions, and common diseases.
NOP552.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the Colleges of Human Medicine and Osteopathic Medicine.

NOP590.name: Special Topics in Clinical Neuroscience
NOP590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NOP590.description: Work under the direction of a faculty member on an experimental, theoretical or applied problem in clinical neuroscience or neurology.

NOP603.name: Core Clinical Concepts
NOP603.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NOP603.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

NOP617.name: Neurology Clerkship
NOP617.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NOP617.description: Office and inpatient experience. Evaluation and management of neurological disease.
NOP617.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Human Medicine.

NOP620.name: Ophthalmology Clerkship
NOP620.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NOP620.description: Study in general or specialty neurology and ophthalmology.
NOP620.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

NOP656.name: Core Neurology Clerkship
NOP656.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NOP656.description: Clinical exposure in neurology. Proficiency in motor skills, aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation, diagnosis, management, and therapy.
NOP656.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

NOP657.name: Neurology Specialty Clerkship
NOP657.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NOP657.description: Clinical exposure in specialties of Neurology. Proficiency in motor skills and aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation; diagnosis; management; therapy.
NOP657.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

NOP835.name: Neuroepidemiology
NOP835.description: Epidemiology of neurologic and neuropsychiatric disorders with emphases on neurodegenerative disorders (e.g., Alzheimer's disease).
NOP835.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics or approval of department.
